data.sampled:
Okay! Here we go!
1KHS(aq) + 3H2O(l) -> 1K+(s) + 2H2(g)
In this reaction, K+ and OH- ions from the saltwater (aqueous solution of sodium chloride or common table salt) react with water molecules to produce potassium hydroxide (a solid) and hydrogen gas (which leaves the liquid as bubbles). This is a double displacement reaction, in which two aqueous species exchange places at the expense of another solvent molecule. It can also be written as an equilibrium mixture where both forward and reverse reactions occur simultaneously until one of them becomes dominant under standard conditions due to its lower energy state. You may use it to make your own baking soda.
Let me know how I did! :)
